name: Gridware
headline: Protecting the grid today, preparing the grid for tomorrow
description:
Gridware exists to enhance and protect the mother of all networks: the electrical grid. The grid touches everyone and makes our modern economy possible. But it’s also fragile. When the grid is compromised, everything grinds to a halt, and the consequences can be dire: wildfires burn, land is destroyed, property is damaged, progress stops, and lives are lost.  

Our team builds smart sensors that help utility companies to immediately detect, find, and fix outages and take steps to prevent new outages, and other related disasters, from happening at all. The need for power will only increase. We protect the grid of today while we build the grid of tomorrow.  

Gridware is privately held and backed by the best climate-tech and Silicon Valley investors. We are headquartered in the Bay Area in northern California.

founders.name: Tim Barat, Founder
founders.description: Former Lineman, Electrician, Engineer, now Entrepreneur working on California's wildfire problem.

founders.name: Abdulrahman Bin Omar, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder & Operations Director @Gridware. Previously worked at Schlumberger, Aramco, and KAPSARC. M.S. in Product Development from UC Berkeley.

founders.name: Hall Chen, Founder
founders.description: Protecting utility infrastructure and fighting wildfires @Gridware

# Grid
# Hard
# Soft
# ware
Protecting the grid today, preparing the grid for tomorrow
[Contact Us](https://www.gridware.io/</contact-us>)
At Gridware, we collaborate with utility companies to enhance existing grid assets with cutting-edge technology. This innovative approach streamlines monitoring, management and troubleshooting processes, ensuring a more reliable and efficient grid for all.
![detection icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f6a840d12229022d801b20b_fault_detection.svg)
# Detect Faults in Real-Time
Gridware’s system allows utilities to identify and locate faults —including those caused by grid equipment failure, downed lines or vegetation contact—helping to reduce outages and wildfire threat in real-time.
![fault detection](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f85d8618cc477086660c90c_gridware%20real%20time%20fault%20detection.gif)
![expedite repairs icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f6a843f61bad82fe4fa2dcc_time_reduction.svg)
# Expedite Outage Repairs
Gridware’s system operates independently of the grid, including during planned or unplanned outage events. This enables utilities to dispatch line crews to the exact location of the problem informed with the knowledge of what to expect once they get there. 
![sketch showing vegetation contact with power lines](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f6a81ee1a52cf80ebe7512d_reducing_time.gif)
![asset health icon](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f6a841b40f1374638dd4252_improving%20\(1\).svg)
# Manage Asset Health
Gridware's system tracks wear and tear on physical assets—including environmental, wildlife, and physical stress unique to each asset. This data-driven approach uses condition-based information to prioritize maintenance schedules, ultimately extending the lifespan of the infrastructure.
![sketch showing vegetation contact with power lines](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/5f6a81ee05a095160ea9ab32_improving_grid.gif)
Currently deployed by utilities in **11** states
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/5f63a76813dd73fadf451b24/67a25dbd74fe528585867ce2_e7c13febfcc5afa8b7cecb5c2753d787_GRIDWARE_US_MAP_10.png)

generated_description:
**Gridware: Safeguarding the Backbone of Our Modern World**

Founded in 2020 and based in Walnut Creek, California, Gridware is on a mission to protect today’s electrical grid while laying the groundwork for its future. As the electrical grid underpins our modern economy, its fragility poses serious consequences: outages can lead to wildfires, property damage, and even loss of life. This is where Gridware steps in.

The company's ingenious team of 50 is developing state-of-the-art smart sensors that empower utility companies to detect, locate, and rectify outages in real time. By prioritizing preventative measures, Gridware not only addresses existing problems but also mitigates future risks, thereby creating a more resilient grid. They're already deployed in 11 states, working closely with utilities to enhance the reliability and efficiency of power delivery.

Gridware's innovative technology allows for real-time fault identification—grabbing attention to equipment failures or vegetation contact that could cause outages. Their systems operate independently, even during outages, enabling utility crews to respond quickly and effectively to issues. Additionally, Gridware's approach to asset health management means that they can track the wear and tear on grid infrastructure, optimizing maintenance schedules and extending asset lifespans.

With the pressing demand for electricity only expected to rise, Gridware's role is indispensable. They are backed by top investors in the climate-tech and Silicon Valley space, including Y Combinator, which speaks volumes about their potential.

For those in the climate and energy sectors, Gridware is on the cutting edge of a crucial transformation that is both practical and forward-thinking. If you're interested in learning more or connecting with them, check out their website at [gridware.io](https://www.gridware.io).
